title: St Germain (musician)
text:
Ludovic Navarre (, born 10 April 1969), known by his stage name St Germain, is a <a href="French%20people">French</a> musician. His style has been described as being a combination of <a href="House%20music">house</a> and <a href="nu%20jazz">nu jazz</a> music.
Career.
Navarre's album "<a href="Boulevard%20%28St%20Germain%20album%29">Boulevard</a>" was released in July 1995 and has sold over one million copies worldwide. His <a href="United%20States">United States</a> debut, "<a href="Tourist%20%28Saint%20Germain%20album%29">Tourist</a>", was released in 2000 and sold 300,000 copies in the USA and four million copies worldwide. <a href="Bob%20Marley">Bob Marley</a>, <a href="Toots%20%26amp%3B%20the%20Maytals">Toots & the Maytals</a>, <a href="Miles%20Davis">Miles Davis</a> and <a href="Kool%20and%20the%20Gang">Kool and the Gang</a> are among Ludovic's early influences. He composed his first work under the name of Sub System with friend <a href="Guy%20Rabiller">Guy Rabiller</a>. He has released EPs under a number of aliases, among them Deepside, LN'S, Modus Vivendi, Nuages and Soofle.
St Germain is not associated with the <a href="Saint-Germain-des-Pr%C3%A9s%20Caf%C3%A9">Saint-Germain-des-Prés Café</a> compilation series, though his song "Deep in It" is featured on its "Volume 1".
His song "Rose Rouge" was featured in the official movie trailer for <a href="Joss%20Whedon">Joss Whedon</a>'s 2013 "<a href="Much%20Ado%20About%20Nothing%20%282012%20film%29">Much Ado About Nothing</a>".
His <a href="St%20Germain%20%28album%29">eponymous album</a>, released on 9 October 2015, was recorded with the participation of African musicians, the album features traditional Malian instruments such as <a href="kora%20%28instrument%29">kora</a>, <a href="balafon">balafon</a> and <a href="ngoni%20%28instrument%29">ngoni</a>, that mingle with electric guitars, pianos, saxophones and electronic loops. The first single, “Real Blues”, sets the voice of Lightnin’ Hopkins to the beat of wild, fiery drums and percussion.
The original single sleeve is decorated with a 3D mask conceived by Urban Art creator Gregos, known for his smiling and frowning faces stuck on walls throughout Paris and Europe.
St Germain was included in the line-up for Coachella 2016.
